metadata.title: Shape-Sensing Robotic-Assisted Bronchoscopy vs Digital Tomosynthesis-Corrected Electromagnetic Navigation Bronchoscopy: A Comparative Cohort Study of Diagnostic Performance

sections.abstract: Background: Digital tomosynthesis-corrected electromagnetic navigation bronchoscopy (DT-ENB) enables near-real-time intraprocedural visualization of peripheral pulmonary lesions (PPLs). Shape-sensing robotic-assisted bronchoscopy (ssRAB) offers improved catheter stability and articulation but lacks real-time localization. Research question: Does the diagnostic yield of ssRAB differ from DT-ENB for PPL biopsy? Study design and methods: Retrospective comparative cohort study of prospectively collected consecutive procedures during the first 6 months after each platform's introduction at a single center. Diagnostic yield was defined as malignancy or specific benign histopathology explaining the PPL; nonspecific inflammation, normal lung/airway, and atypia not diagnostic of malignancy were nondiagnostic. Results: ssRAB biopsied 143 PPLs in 133 patients; DT-ENB biopsied 197 PPLs in 170 patients. Diagnostic yield was 77% (110/143) for ssRAB and 80% (158/197) for DT-ENB (OR 0.8, 95% CI 0.5-1.4; P = .4). Median lesion diameters were 17 mm (ssRAB) and 19 mm (DT-ENB). After adjustment for lesion size, bronchus sign, location (peripheral vs middle third), and sex, results were similar (OR 0.87, 95% CI 0.49-1.6; P = .6). Pneumothorax occurred in 1.5% (2/133) with ssRAB and 1.8% (3/170) with DT-ENB (P = .86). Interpretation: ssRAB and DT-ENB had comparable diagnostic performance and safety using a conservative diagnostic yield definition.
sections.methods: Design: Retrospective analysis of prospectively collected data for consecutive navigational bronchoscopies within the first 6 months after introduction of each platform at Vanderbilt University Medical Center. Platforms and windows: DT-ENB introduced April 25, 2018; ssRAB introduced November 3, 2021. Patients undergoing DT-ENB during the ssRAB window only due to enrollment in a randomized trial (VERITAS, NCT04250194) were excluded. Procedures: Board-certified interventional pulmonologists or fellows under supervision performed all cases under general anesthesia with neuromuscular blockade, 8.5-mm ETT, post-intubation recruitment maneuver (40 cm H2O for 40 s), PEEP 15 cm H2O, and minimized FiO2 to limit atelectasis. DT-ENB used superDimension (Medtronic) with digital tomosynthesis. ssRAB used the ION platform (Intuitive Surgical) with PlanPoint planning and shape-sensing catheter; registration by airway maneuvering; vision probe removed for biopsy. Radial endobronchial ultrasound was used in all patients, with fluoroscopic guidance. Initial sampling by transbronchial needle aspiration (21G Arcpoint needle for DT-ENB; 19/21/23G Flexision needles for ssRAB), with ROSE; additional forceps/brush/peripheral wash at operator discretion. Outcomes: Primary—difference in diagnostic yield (lesional histopathology: malignancy or specific benign pattern). Nondiagnostic included normal lung/airway, nonspecific inflammation, atypia not diagnostic. Secondary—factors associated with yield; complications per national QI definitions. Analysis: Wilcoxon rank-sum and chi-square tests for baseline comparisons; logistic regression for platform-yield association adjusted for nodule size, bronchus sign, location (peripheral vs middle third), and sex; robust sandwich estimator for within-patient correlation (multiple PPLs). Sensitivity analysis restricted to first PPL per patient.
sections.results: A total of 197 PPLs in 170 patients underwent DT-ENB and 143 PPLs in 133 patients underwent ssRAB within the defined 6-month periods. Median lesion sizes: 19 mm (IQR 14-28) for DT-ENB and 17 mm (IQR 12-27) for ssRAB. DT-ENB had more peripheral one-third lesions (80.7% vs 48.0%; P < .001) and more women (59.4% vs 45.1%; P = .013); bronchus sign prevalence and nodule density were similar. Primary outcome: Diagnostic yield was 80% (158/197) for DT-ENB vs 77% (110/143) for ssRAB (OR 0.8, 95% CI 0.5-1.4; P = .4). Pathology among DT-ENB cases: 54% malignant (107/197) and 26% specific benign (51/197); among ssRAB: 55% malignant (78/143) and 22% specific benign (32/143). Adjusted analysis (size, bronchus sign, location, sex): OR 0.87 (95% CI 0.49-1.6; P = .6). Sensitivity (first PPL per patient): 81% (138/170) DT-ENB vs 80% (106/133) ssRAB; OR 0.9 (95% CI 0.5-1.6; P = .7); adjusted OR 1.0 (95% CI 0.5-1.8; P = .9). Factors associated with diagnostic yield overall included larger nodule size, concentric radial EBUS view, and solid density. Platform-specific: DT-ENB—solid density (OR 4.4, 95% CI 1.9-9.9; P = .001); ssRAB—bronchus sign (OR 3.1, 95% CI 1.2-7.7; P = .015) and concentric radial EBUS (OR 3.5, 95% CI 1.4-8.4; P = .004). Complications: Pneumothorax in 1.5% (2/133) of ssRAB and 1.8% (3/170) of DT-ENB (P = .86); chest tube required in 2 ssRAB patients and 1 DT-ENB patient; no bleeding requiring intervention.

population.text: Adults undergoing navigational bronchoscopy for biopsy of peripheral pulmonary lesions at a single academic medical center within the first 6 months after platform introduction.
inclusion_criteria: Consecutive navigational bronchoscopy procedures performed within 6 months of each platform’s introduction
Peripheral pulmonary lesion targeted for biopsy
Availability of preprocedure chest CT for planning
exclusion_criteria: Procedures during the ssRAB window performed with DT-ENB solely due to enrollment in an external randomized trial (VERITAS; NCT04250194)

intervention.text: Shape-sensing robotic-assisted bronchoscopy (ssRAB; ION platform, Intuitive Surgical)
intervention.details: PlanPoint-based preprocedure planning; shape-sensing catheter with vision probe; registration by maneuvering airways in all lobes; radial EBUS and fluoroscopic guidance; initial TBNA with 19/21/23G Flexision needles; ROSE; additional forceps/brush/peripheral wash per operator.

comparison.text: Digital tomosynthesis-corrected electromagnetic navigation bronchoscopy (DT-ENB; superDimension, Medtronic)
comparison.details: Near-real-time intraprocedural lesion localization via digital tomosynthesis; radial EBUS and fluoroscopic guidance; initial TBNA with 21G Arcpoint pulmonary needle; ROSE; additional sampling per operator.

outcomes.name: Diagnostic yield (lesional histopathology: malignancy or specific benign features) at index procedure
Factors associated with diagnostic yield (nodule size, bronchus sign, radial EBUS view, density)

analysis_populations.name: Patient-level
analysis_populations.description: All included patients across both platforms

arms.name: DT-ENB (digital tomosynthesis-corrected electromagnetic navigation bronchoscopy; superDimension)

provenance.quote: Diagnostic yield was 77% for ssRAB (110 of 143 PPLs) and 80% (158 of 197 PPLs) for DT-ENB (OR, 0.8; 95% CI, 0.5-1.4; P = .4).

analysis.model: logistic regression with robust sandwich variance

provenance.quote: A multivariate logistic regression analysis... (OR, 0.87; 95% CI, 0.49-1.6; P = .6).

outcomes_normalized.name: Diagnostic yield (first PPL per patient, unadjusted)

provenance.quote: In a post hoc sensitivity analysis including only the first nodule biopsied per patient, the diagnostic yield was similar with ssRAB (80% [106 of 133]) and DT-ENB (81% [138 of 170]; OR, 0.9; 95% CI, 0.5-1.6; P = .7).

outcomes_normalized.name: Diagnostic yield (first PPL per patient, adjusted)
outcomes_normalized.timepoint_label: Index procedure (first PPL per patient, adjusted)

analysis.model: logistic regression with robust sandwich variance

provenance.quote: Multivariate logistic regression adjusting for the same factors did not differ (OR, 1.0; 95% CI, 0.5-1.8; P = .9).

safety_normalized.management: Tube thoracostomy required in 2/2 ssRAB pneumothoraces and 1/3 DT-ENB pneumothoraces.

provenance.quote: Pneumothorax complicated 1.5% of ssRAB and 1.8% of DT-ENB procedures (P = .86). One patient (0.6%) in the DT-ENB group and 2 patients (1.5%) in the ssRAB group required tube thoracostomy.

domains.name: Confounding
domains.support_for_judgment: Nonrandomized comparative cohort; adjusted for key covariates (size, bronchus sign, location, sex) with robust variance, but residual confounding possible.

domains.name: Selection of participants
domains.support_for_judgment: Consecutive procedures within defined windows; clear exclusion of concurrent RCT-enrolled cases.

domains.name: Classification of interventions
domains.support_for_judgment: Interventions clearly defined by platform and time window.

domains.name: Deviations from intended interventions
domains.support_for_judgment: Standardized anesthesia and procedural protocols; same operators.

domains.name: Missing data
domains.support_for_judgment: All biopsied lesions included; outcomes ascertained at 1 week.

domains.name: Measurement of outcomes
domains.support_for_judgment: Uniform, conservative diagnostic yield definition based on histopathology; blinded outcome assessment not applicable.

domains.name: Selection of the reported result
domains.support_for_judgment: Predefined primary outcome; adjusted and sensitivity analyses reported.

retrieval.summary_tldr: In 340 PPL biopsies, ssRAB 77% (110/143) vs DT-ENB 80% (158/197) diagnostic yield; adjusted OR 0.87 (95% CI 0.49-1.6), P = .6; pneumothorax ~1.5%-1.8% in both.
retrieval.clinical_relevance: ssRAB and DT-ENB demonstrate comparable diagnostic performance and low pneumothorax rates using a conservative histopathology-based yield definition.
